question: 見事
sourceMnemonic: Every single <kanji>thing</kanji> you <kanji>see</kanji> is <vocabulary>splendid</vocabulary>. You saw it after all, so of course it's <vocabulary>magnificent</vocabulary>. Your eyes are so great that they make everything reflect you. And you're <vocabulary>beautiful</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The readings for this word are both kun'yomi readings. You learned them already, so you should be able to read this on your own. Just remember that there is rendaku on <ja>こと</ja> and it becomes <ja>ごと</ja>.
